intro: Microlicia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or pale purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
